TITLE.P: 2664_18 Property, building and infrastructure advice and management services

SHORT_DESCR.P: An ESPO national Framework to provide a reliable and competent source of property advice & management services including, project management and general and technical advice on property matters.

TITLE.P: Project management and general and technical advice on building and property matters — London and The Southeast

SHORT_DESCR.P: The provision of project management services and general and technical advice for buildings and property, including but not limited to management services, planning services, feasibility studies, production of specifications, cost management, programme management, design services, CDM services, civil engineering services, architect services, technologist services, surveyors services, mechanical and electrical services and procurement services for further building and property services that may be required such as all types of construction work including new builds, extensions, renovation and repair works.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 12 months. The total estimated value stated in Section II.1.7, includes the option period.

TITLE.P: Project management and general and technical advice on building and property matters — The rest of the UK (i.e. excluding London and The Southeast)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The provision of project management services and general and technical advice for buildings and property, including but not limited to management services, planning services, feasibility studies, production of specifications, cost management, programme management, design services, CDM services, civil engineering services, architect services, technologist services, surveyors services, mechanical and electrical services and procurement services for further building and property services that may be required such as all types of construction work including new builds, extensions, renovation and repair works.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 12 months. The total estimated value stated in Section II.1.7, includes the option period.

TITLE.P: Project management and general and technical advice on infrastructure matters — London and The Southeast

SHORT_DESCR.P: The provision of a project management services and general and technical advice for infrastructure, including but not limited to management services, planning services, feasibility studies, production of specifications, cost management, programme management, design services, CDM services, civil engineering services, architect services, technologist services, surveyors services, mechanical and electrical services and procurement services for further infrastructure services that may be required such as all types of construction, renovation and repair works.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The framework agreement has the option to extend for up to a further 12 months. The total estimated value stated in Section II.1.7, includes the option period.

TITLE.P: Project management and general and technical advice on infrastructure matters — The rest of the UK (i.e.excluding London and The Southeast)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The provision of a project management services and general and technical advice for infrastructure, including but not limited to management services, planning services, feasibility studies, production of specifications, cost management, programme management, design services, CDM services, civil engineering services, architect services, technologist services, surveyors services, mechanical and electrical services and procurement services for further infrastructure services that may be required such as all types of construction, renovation and repair works.

TITLE.P: Project management and general and technical advice on building and property matters — London and The Southeast

INFO_ADD.P: As a Central Purchasing Body as defined by the EU Procurement Directive 2014/24/EU, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined https://www.espo.org/ESPO/media/Documents/FAQs/ESPO-s_powers_to_trade__website_-2016-12-22.pdf) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas is available on: http://www.espo.org/About-us-%281 %29/FAQs/Legal.

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: Information on deadlines(s) for review procedures can be found in Part 3, Chapter 6 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.
